data.title: Need to reopen all windows to update scope of inner terminal
data.body:
#### Versions:
- VSCode: 1.14.0
- OS: Windows 10 [10.0.14393]

#### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open one or more VSCode windows (instances, projects);
2. Using any terminal, install any library globally (i.e. Java, or `npm install -g <package>`);
3. Without exiting the opened VSCode window, launch one more;

#### Expected:
the installed library to be visible in the inner terminal of newly opened VSCode window.

#### Reproduces without extensions:
Yes

data.title: Upgrade to V1.14.0 is a bad dream
data.body:
I am using VS Code to debug a RN project. as I upgrade to V1.14.0 this morning, a bad dream is coming:
1. The 'Stop Debug' button act as 'Reset', have to double-click to stop debugging
2. The 'Reset' button reload the apk endlessly
3. The apk always stopped at 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6321512/28108896-b4f47ce2-671f-11e7-96cb-61045d81e284.png)
except the first load

How to downgrade VS Code?

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.14.0 - OS Version: Windows 8 When trying to open a specific folder in VSCode through command line using command code . Instead of opening a folder in a single new window only it opens two new windows and that folder in both the windows.

data.title: Support custom views in Debug viewlet
data.body: With loaded scripts view feature, we need to support custom views in Debug viewlet. `debug` is the location to contribute views to Debug viewlet.

data.title: macOS: Select all does not work in file picker
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new File, Save As... (file picker appears)
2. Click at the end of the filename or use cursor (selection of "Untitled-1" gone)
3. Cmd+A or to select all characters does not work in the filepicker

data.title: Javascript formatting has changed considerably
The window is no longer responding
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: v1.14
- OS Version: macOS Sierra - v10.12.5 (16F73)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on the update notification shown by the vscode editor.
2. After reopening it, the editor is frozen and displays a dialog shown in below screenshot.
3. I even trashed the "Applications/Visual Studio Code.app" file and download/installed a fresh zip from https://code.visualstudio.com/. Still, the same issue persists. I neither can write a single line, nor interact with file explorer menu items, or do anything else. It keeps in the frozen state even if I restart it.

![welcome 2017-07-12 13-09-18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/876195/28107165-3f226882-6704-11e7-8adb-106de2836d85.png)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: 
I couldn't check this as I get `command not found: code` when I run `code --disable-extensions`.

data.title: There is no Find text option in CSV preview
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1.install Excel preview plugin(Powered by Wijmo)
2. Click on preview button in right hand side while opening a csv file.
3. CSV file opens in Grid view fashion. But  press Ctrl+F button  
4. You can observe that Find dialog box never appear. 
Result is  could not able to scroll to right cell .

Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: 1.14.0 version don't debug start Electron
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: MAC 10.12

`    {  

      "name": "Debug",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/win.js"  

    }    `

Result error: Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:29675).

But, the configuration settings was work in 1.13.1

data.title: Emmet doesn't work with vue files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. set in settings
```
  "emmet.useNewEmmet": true,
  "emmet.includeLanguages": {
    "vue-html": "html"
  }
```
2. open vue file
3. start typing ul>li [press TAB]
nothing happens. 
But if I use Ctrl+Shift+P and select **Emmet: Expand Abbreviation** then it works

Also in HTML file I have this nice intellisense with preview how tags will be expanded. In vue file nothing like that appears




<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Can reproduce with only vetur extension enabled

data.title: Bug: Markdown Preview does not work; shows a blank page: VSCode 1.14.0
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an empty file, type in some words, and save it as "test.md"
2. Commands "Markdown: Open Preview" and "Markdown: Open Preview to the Side" both do not work: a blank preview page is open, no words displayed.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes, the bug still exists.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18319900/28105172-36360ede-6693-11e7-96d6-f861e6d844c9.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18319900/28105216-671cdf8c-6693-11e7-9be4-a39a9c20e455.png)

data.title: Javascript definitions break with node_modules
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40)
- OS Version: OSX 10.10.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open first file, hold command, hover above item. Item turns blue and is underlined with a preview.
2. Open second file, hold command, hovering above item does nothing.
3. Additionally, right clicking item and selecting context menu 'Go to definition' will provide the error 'No definitions found for ...'

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Additional info: Using ES6 in Nodejs projects. Files include module.exports, let/const keywords and multi-line comments.

Edit:
- The second file can be completely empty and the first file still provides no definitions.
- Bug is inconsistence and only happens for particular files. Perhaps a linting problem?
- ~~I think I've narrowed the bug down to a path problem. It happens when files are nested 3 layers deep. Example: root/1/2/3/file.js (Needs more verification)~~
- Path problem assumption was wrong and it appears to be a `node_modules` issue.

data.title: Test failing in Code 1.14 checking isActive on extension after openTextDocument
Regression June 2017: Flickering when resizing window or resizing terminal panel
data.body:
On the latest June release there is some severe lagging and flickering on the main window on resizing the editor. That wasn't the case before the last update.

- VSCode Version: June 2017 (1.14)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5
- Macbook Pro with Retina screen

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open any file
2. resize window or the terminal split panel

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

I made some screen recordings to visualize the problem:

![flicker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/873717/28103407-da37f096-66d5-11e7-98c9-8f021a92f366.gif)
![scale-lag](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/873717/28103408-da615422-66d5-11e7-8a33-a8ed333acb09.gif)

data.title: Multi root++
data.body:
Introduces the concept of a workspace that can be opened.

fyi @Tyriar the backup service is getting a new method to store backups per workspace (now we have per folder and for empty windows). this is needed because workspaces have their own backup location.

data.title: Publish node2 with localizations
data.body: Didn't quite get these in time for 1.14...

data.title: Got a pink background color status bar
data.body: Pink is not my color. I want change a different color. The question is how to change it? Thanks.

data.title: Add duplicate Current line or current selection by shortcut
data.body: In notepad++ I can duplicate current line or selection Text by pressing Ctrl+D. It's similar to Copy and Paste  right after caret position. Hope that, I can do the same in Vscode

data.title: How can I extend tree view from the main explorer?
data.body:
Suppose I have `.cs` file in my project and it was shown in explorer properly. But then I want to add symbol tree view to that `.cs` file

Can I register my tree on the main explorer?
Where could I hook the main explorer instead of create custom tree?

data.title: Insider builds not being published to the Debian repo since July 5th
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.15.0-insider / 1.15.0-1499795530 (ec5b0498651bde043ec357a8f36d475cc0880cfc)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 17.04 / `uname --srop`: Linux 4.10.0-26-generic GNU/Linux`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `apt-get update`
2. See that no updates are available
3. Do this for several more days and wonder why code-insiders doesn't show up
4. Go to the package repo in a browser and observe that this is because there are [no updates published](https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/vscode/pool/main/c/code-insiders/) ðŸ˜¢ 
5. Think maybe there is a blocking issue, but can find nothing obvious with that commit
6. Download code-insiders manually and see that you get a newer version (1.15.0-1499795530), so be sad that the repo is just out of date.

Too much post-4th of July partying at the VS Code team? ðŸ˜‰

Reproduces without extensions: Yes
